29.text: Welcome to Fieldsports Britain. Coming up:

32.text:
The anti bashing beauty: we speak to the Czech
model who shoots from the hip.

37.text:
Sprint and shoot: target shooting to get the
heart racing.

41.text:
First, it's the start of our new series 'Rucksack

69.text:
What does hunting or shooting mean to you?
For Tim Pilbeam it's a rucksack, a rifle and

93.text: a chance to breathe in a new experience.

96.text:
We're exploring the beautiful Croatian coastline
and countryside looking for a trophy mouflon,

102.text:
an animal that clings to on the unforgiving
rocks of the Dalmatian riviera, and we are

107.text:
after roe and boar in a vast hunting area
filled with flower meadows and forests.

112.text:
We have moved inland to about an hour and
a half from where we were on the coast. Very

118.text:
very different terrain. Just look at it, this
is woodland, rolling mountains here. None

127.text:
of the hard rock we had down on the coast.
It's a very different type of stalking. We're

133.text:
on roe this morning. We're probably a fraction
late at the moment so we need to get in there

136.text:
pretty quickly. So it's a very different skill-set
here so we are very much relying on our guides

138.text:
to take us round hopefully to find a nice
roe, so we need to get going.

146.text:
The trip has been arranged through Artemis
Hunting and our young guide is Pavle. He and

150.text:
his father Mario know every inch of this strange
landscape. Sometimes it looks like home, other

157.text:
During the winter they feed the boar using
this lofty maize dispensing unit. Dinner is

163.text: served at the same time every evening.

166.text:
And it feeds the boar once a day at 6 o'clock.
And you have these all around the estate.

167.text: OK. So you have got a high seat over there?

177.text: 50 metres away. That's your feeding spot.

190.text:
Pavle spots a roe and changes up from his
normal sedate-style to a jog to get a better

195.text:
look. The deer and boar are naturally timid.
They have more than a man with a Sauer 101

201.text:
in .308 to worry about here. It's gone, but
we still have a few hours before storms are

Absolutely stunning place, the tall grass,

variety of flowers. And to see the roe deer

The heads are not any great size here because

down next to the woods. We came through there,

Like in many European countries, the animal

You were saying that in Croatia the deer have

They are really shy because we get a lot of

we get the lynx. We got all the predators

is to use his Harkila rucksack to carry out

385.text:
Now I have not done this before. Just trying
one of the Harkila rucksacks out which carries

391.text:
a roe deer. I think normally one would gut
it first and then put it in here but I want

398.text:
to take it back to the car and then deal with
it then.

406.text:
I don't want to disrespect the animal too
much but...

416.text:
This is not a typically British thing to do,
but there's a first time for everything. If

420.text:
you're on your own it's a very efficient way

432.text:
This trip is as much about the experience
as the hunting. We are asked to get a fire

439.text:
For this trip Tim has a Sauer 101 with a Zeiss
V8 scope on top. It means he's comfortable

445.text:
shooting 300 metres across a valley or 100
metres in a meadow, but with glass like this

450.text: you need to establish a work flow.

452.text:
Very versatile optics we got here I've got
a 150-metre zero, and the reason I've gone

458.text:
for that is that I am shooting mouflon from
probably 100 metres to 350 metres, so a huge

463.text:
range there. Most of the roe here are probably
60 to 70 metres and a boar here would be about

469.text:
between 30 and 70 metres, so I've got quite
a wide range of uses for this. But be very

476.text:
careful. The more things you can adjust the
more things can go wrong. You must have a

482.text:
discipline. Every time you finish using a
rifle, wind it back to zero. Otherwise it

490.text:
will catch you out. It is done. Same with
your windage. And also I do the same thing

496.text:
with my parallax. I try and keep my parallax
at around 150 all the time. If I'm shooting

500.text:
beyond 200 metres I will probably tweak it
a little bit. But please, please when your

505.text:
using these target turrets, make sure you
always wind them back.

510.text:
Back to lunch and we're expecting some fresh
roe liver but, instead, Mario returns with

514.text:
some home dry cured pork belly. Some is eaten
raw, some sliced and cooked over the fire.

519.text: For Tim this is what it's all about.

522.text: It is such a tasty bit of meat. Beautiful.

For more information about hunting in Croatia

564.text:
First, more on the story that just keeps on
giving. Rock legend Brian May views on foxes

570.text:
has landed him in trouble with actor Michael
J Fox. Queen founding member and national

576.text:
treasure Brian May has launched Team Fox,
a coalition of animal welfare groups including

581.text:
the League Against Cruel Sports and the Land
Rover-sponsored Born Free Foundation, which

586.text:
opposes repeal of the ban on hunting with
dogs in England and Wales. Meanwhile, Michael

591.text:
J Fox’s Team Fox has raised more than £20
million for research into Parkinson’s disease

600.text:
George Digweed has won his 25th world title.
And he did it in style, dropping just one

608.text:
target to shoot 199 ex200. Congratulations
George.

614.text:
US spy agencies may start hunting wildlife
poachers in Africa. American intelligence

621.text:
is considering whether to provide information,
analysis and possibly tactical lessons to

626.text:
African governments about how to attack wildlife
poaching networks, according to a top official.

633.text:
Poachers killed 40,000 elephants in 2011 and,
last year, in South Africa’s Kruger National

637.text: Park alone, they killed 1,200 white rhinos.

642.text:
Hunting rabbits with dogs is becoming more
popular in South Africa. A photographer went

647.text:
out with a group who run their dogs together.
Ten hunters from Soweto hired a taxi to take

653.text:
them with their greyhounds and lurchers to
land in the West Rand area of Johannesburg.

657.text:
The hunt starts early so the dogs do not get
too hot to work. The hunters and their families

663.text:
skin and eat the rabbits. However, hunting
with dogs is illegal in South Africa, except

668.text: for tracking a wounded animal or bird shooting.

672.text:
A court has ruled that it is illegal to shoot
down a drone in California. Eric Joe sued

679.text:
Brett McBay after Mr McBay shot down Mr Joe’s
hexacopter, which he said was spying on him.

685.text:
A California court found that Mr McBay "acted
unreasonably" in shooting the craft whether

691.text:
it was over his property or not and awarded
Mr Joe USD850 in damages.

696.text:
And finally, great retrieving skills has saved
a chicken’s life. The hen escaped a fox

703.text:
in its coop in Nottinghamshire by flying across
a canal. The following morning, its owner

707.text:
could not get it back, so called in his friend
Paul Mallatratt and his nine-year-old Labrador

712.text:
Fern. Showing the importance of a soft mouth,
Fern brought the chick home - and it is already

720.text:
You are now up to date with Fieldsports Channel
News. Stalking the stories, fishing for facts!

752.text:

We are at Pirbright, next to the National

776.text:
There are three similar but different events

It is a big favourite of the Omanis, the reigning

786.text:

hard. They even have their own camera crew.

791.text:
Their main opponents are not the British but
the Canadians.

794.text:
Bisley is probably one of the most prestigious
shooting events you can come to. You know

798.text:
what I mean? There's some all over the world
but Bisley has so much history it goes way

803.text:
back. Its on everybody's bucket list. You
have to do Bisley.

806.text: Do you come here to win?

807.text:
We always come here to win. The team that
I have right now is a composite team from

812.text:
all across Canada. They are basically taken
from the top 50 best in Canada: who is the

818.text:
fastest, who's the best shot. We always put
our best team forward.

823.text:
Each team of four starts lying prone then,
on command, run 100 yards to the shooting

831.text:
position to take down the steel plate targets
in front of them in the quickest time.

835.text:
Fastest team down there does not necessarily
win, all right? You can get down there faster

839.text:
but you still have knock down what is down
there. And that is where the accuracy part

859.text: In the finals it is the Canadians that triumph.

863.text:
And guess what, that is one of the things

guys and girls as they won't be using semi-auto

way from Devon to compete having got her FAC
10 years ago.

889.text:
Well this is an AR-15, which is a straight

895.text:

906.text:
don't have to buy one new. You could always

911.text:
easiest and the most common rifle that we

916.text:
rifles. If you've got something with a 10-round

920.text:
They are all either what we call straight

924.text:
and most of them will be military caliber

930.text:
with a heavier 7.62 bullet is that it knocks

Most of the teams that seem to be doing well

1066.text:

But I promise you the countryside is even

My name is Michaela, I am Czech, and I am
out in the countryside every day. I live near

1190.text:

It’s another day, another morning in a forest,

possibly we could see some wild boar. So,

Wild boar are so shy, this is the best way

Well the morning hunt wasn’t successful-

She knows there is something there. She can’t

1356.text:
We are quite formal in the Czech Republic
and we really like tradition. The stalker

1362.text:
performs a ceremony he does with every deer
successfully hunted on this land.

1369.text:
So if you are wondering what we are doing
- what this branch means - it is the last

1376.text:
honour, which we do here in Central Europe.
Our tradition - and it is, like, a last honour

1384.text:
for game. So, this is what we do - we honour
game with a last meal - we call it 'the last

1394.text:
meal' - and it’s a tradition of Central
Europe. Another one goes into my hat and it

1402.text:
means I was successful today. I was a successful

1433.text: Czech Republic is still my favourite place.
